group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
Hi M2mmers,

In our first meeting, we'll be setting the scene. For those not familiar with the idea's behind the Internet of Things, we'll give an overview of what is going on in this field.

Afterwards we will have a open discussion on what topics we could cover the next sessions and how we will organize them.

Agenda:

- Presentation: Internet of Thing: an overview (19:00)

- Open Discussion (20:00)

- Setup the agenda for the next meetups

 

We'll be ordering pizza's around 19:30. So if you are late, call us to let us now what you willl have.

 

See you the 4th of July,

Frederik
name: 1st Meetup: Open Discussion

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
In light of our upcoming first project "Intelligent Lighting", in our second meetup we will dive into the topic "Sensor networking with Zigbee".

Agenda:

Presentation: Introduction on sensor networks Dive into ZigBee ZigBee alternatives/competitors Practical: Creating a ZigBee based remote control. We will provide the necessary hardware (XBee, Arduino,...).
name: Mesh networking with ZigBee

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
Project description

Nowadays Smart Lighting is a hot topic, especially within the context of Smart Roads.

Adding intelligence to street lights yields lower energy usage, allows to exclusively use green energy and reduce the current light pollution.

But it doesn't stop here. Having environment-sensing street lights connected to the internet could be a powerfull innovation platform on itself.

In this project we will explore the possibilities of Smart (Road/Street) Lighting and the challenges that come along.

We will brainstorm on what kind of sensor network architecture (& related technologies) would be most feasible, how the sensor data can be channeled to the internet and what we can do with this (big) data, how smart lighting could accomodate e.g. Smart Cars. What other innovations can we expect in the field of Smart Roads, ....

In short, a lot of interesting topics to cover and of course, we won't be able to put all this good stuff into one session :-). 5 projects sessions are planned within this project.

Iluminas, specialized in lighting solutions, will guide us and provide us with valuable information about typical requirements, challenges and constraints for these type of solutions.

The agenda of the first session:

* Intelligent Lighting Explained (Korneel Verleden - Iluminas)

* Going Smart Off-grid: possibilities and constraints (Korneel Verleden - Iluminas)

* Brainstorm: off/on grid intelligent sensor networks in a long-thin topology

Speaker: Ing. Korneel Verleden - Iluminas

Vanuit de opleiding elektrotechniek/automatisering heeft Korneel reeds onderzoek verricht naar smart grid toepassingen en daarbij gebruikte netwerkprotocollen.
Daarna stond hij in Lemcko, expertisecentrum energie en power quality mee aan het roer bij het ontwikkelen van een software voor het afnemen van energie audits in opdracht van Vito.
In XiaK, eXpertisecentrum Industriële Automatisering Kortrijk, werd de kennis rond industriële netwerken verder aangescherpt.
Vanuit deze expertise in elektrotechniek, energie en automatisering is Korneel werkzaam bij Iluminas NV, fabrikant van innovatieve verlichtingstoestellen.

Hiernaast is Korneel begaan met enkele automatiseringsprojecten in bijberoep, voornamelijk met betrekking tot industriële camera visie applicaties.
Daarnaast volgt hij deeltijds de opleiding master of science in management aan de faculteit economie en bedrijfswetenschappen aan de KUL.

Venue

We thank iMinds for facilitating this meetup.
name: Project "Smart Street Lighting" - Session 1

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
Intro

Smart cities... lots of discussions, lots of ideas, but what is currently being done on this field? What kind of solutions are implemented and in what domains? What technologies are being used? How to handle all the (big) data gathered?

In this session, we will give IoT a face and look into some real solutions.

We thank IBM to host this event.

IMPORTANT: in order to register for this event you will need to, beside the usual RSVP, send your full name, email and company (and country if not Belgium) to [masked]. Registration will end on 18/10/2013!

If you're not sure you will make it, register anyway. Otherwise you will not get on the parking and pass security...

 

Session details

This session aims to give you an insight on IBM Smarter Cities technologies through concrete use cases and demos. IBM proposes Smart Cities industry solution software products in the areas of public safety, social services, infrastructure operations, water management, public transportation and traffic management.

We will cover all the IBM Smarter Cities solutions portfolio with a deeper focus on the functional capabilities of the new version 1.6 of the flagship IBM Intelligent Operations Center product.

Agenda

*  18:30 - 19:00 Welcome

*  19:00 - 19:30 Overview of IBM Smarter Cities software solutions

*  19:30 - 20:00 Focus on the core platform: Intelligent Operations Center

*  20:00 - 20:30 Insight into the solutions for Transport, Water, Public Safety

*  20:30 - 21:00 Sandwich dinner

*  21:00 - 21:30 Semantic Model

*  21:30 - 22:00 Q&A and Closing

Speaker

Robin has joined the IT community in 1992 when he suddenly realized that software development was more interesting than windsurfing ;) Since then he has been working in industries like energy, finance, healthcare and telecommunication as developer, project manager, middleware architect and enterprise architect.

In 2001 he has founded the Belgian Websphere User Group and since 2003 has been steering member of the Belgian Java User Group.

Robin is now working for IBM as an architect specialized in Smarter Cities solutions.
name: Smarter cities solutions

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
The future of the Web

The future of the web is about the Integration/convergence of Cloud, API’s, Sensor Networks, Data mining/analytics and Intelligent decision engines. As data we gather and problems we want to solve become more complex and uncertain, I wanted to see whether the AI concepts can help us in dealing with this challenge. For the past few years, I have been building a cloud based AI platform which I applied on the information I could gather over the public API and internet, and this presentation is result of my experiments. 

Agenda

This presentation is divided in two parts:

•  In the first part of the session we will go over state of the art in AI. It will cover basic concepts of intelligent agents, supervised and unsupervised learning, bayesian nets and belief propagation. 

• In the second part I will show case the automated Bayesian orchestration framework, which is is composed of three separated modules: Sensors module: API plugins, to connect to different sensors/API providers, Orchestration engine (with knowledge database and intelligent decision engine) and Action module: action plugins which act on a given decision triggered by the engine. 

Bio

From 1995 till 1997, Veselin worked as a research assistant at University of Novi Sad. From 1997 till 1999 he worked as a doctoral researcher at the Free University of Brussels
(VUB) in the area of digital image processing and pattern recognition applied to the problem of airborne minefield detection. In 1999, he moved to Alcatel, where he was first a software architect in domain of MPLS and IP networks and later architect of DSL Network Analyzer. Since 2003, he was a R&D manager at Network Management Applications Division in Motive. Since 2012, Veselin moved to Ghent’s startup scene, where he was VP engineering at Incubaid and Awingu - companies that are working in domain of the cloud computing. Currently, he works at Ontoforce, where he develops software for semantic analysis of the biomedical data.

Veselin Pizurica is also author and co-author of 12 of patents applications in domain of DSL, home networks and cloud computing.

Catering

Catering is not sponsored for this meetup.
Pizza + beverages: 10 euro/pp.
Beverages: 1euro/pp.
name: Artificial intelligence and IoT

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
This meetup won't torture your neural network  ... too much ;-).

Barcamp


We want to organize this meetup in an OpenSpaceTech style (more information on http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open_Space_Technology) and talk some business. So prepare your questions and we'll discuss them. Try not to think 'technology', try to think 'opportunity' & 'challenges'.

A nice preparation for the barcamp is deze VINT onderzoeksnotitie.

Show & Tell


For those who have been spending all their free time on a home project, can bring along their creations and present them during the break. The latest gadgets are allowed too :-).

Please send an email to [masked] and let us know if you have special requirements for your demo.

Practical

Parking:
name: Barcamp - IoT Business Challenges / Show & Tell

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
ABSTRACT:


The use of mobile technologies really changed the IT landscape. More data is coming in at higher rates and in all kinds of formats. But if we think we can handle that with traditional technologies, we need to think again.  

Big Data provides a solution to these challenges and will allow us to get the most out of our data. We know the Internet Of Things will bring us even more data, but also more opportunities to work with data. So why not explore how these two can work together to achieve even greater results.

AGENDA:

Part 1: Big Data

• What is the buzz all about?

• Why do we need it?


• Technologies


• How does it work?


- Storage

- Processing

• What are the dangers?

- Misconceptions and myths

- The search for talent

Part 2: Combining IoT and Big Data

• Why IoT and Big Data are a great match:

  - Using IoT data

  - Using IoT as a Big Data system

• Using IoT Data:

  - Events

  - Processing

  - Storage

 • Using IoT as a Big Data system:

  - How it would look?

  - Would it work?

Part 3: Discussions


SPEAKER: Daan Gerits

Daan is a Jack-of-all-trades. Apart from being a technology enthusiast, he loves to evangelize and make people aware of new possibilities. He co-organizes BigData.be and is always the linchpin. Currently, he is doing just that at Dasos, the Cronos big data company.


[masked]

http://linkedin.com/in/daangerits

PRACTICAL:

When: Wednesday, January 29,[masked]:00 PM
Where: Imtech ICT België, Guldensporenpark 35 Gebouw D, Merelbeke
@ Sodexo (floor -1)


Catering (food & drinks) sponsored by Imtech ICT België
name: Big Data & IoT - Sensor data analytics

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
The Eclipse IoT community is the home for several open-source projects that every IoT developer should know.

Let's take some time to talk about all these projects and what kind of IoT solutions they can help building.

The presentation will features demos of all these cool technologies, and it is likely that you will leave the evening wishing to use them more! And if you are using some of them already, please drop me a message so as we can try to give the floor to even more demos from the local community!   

AGENDA:

Part 1: Overview of the Eclipse IoT Ecosystem

• History


• Eclipse IoT Projects

      – IoT protocols with Paho, Californium, Wakaama, ...

      – Embedded frameworks for simplifying device access with Mihini and Kura

       – Tools

       – Server-side: Ponte (M2M Bridge Framework, Mosquitto (MQTT Broker)

       – Other cool projects: Eclipse SCADA, Krikkit, SmartHome ...

Part 2: Beyond Eclipse IoT


• Enable development right on your IoT device with Eclipse Orion

• Data visualization


• ...

SPEAKER: Benjamin Cabé

Benjamin Cabé is IoT evangelist at the Eclipse Foundation. He advocates the use of open and innovative technologies for the Internet of Things and likes building crazy machines with Arduino kits and all kinds of open hardware platforms. You can find him online on Twitter or on his blog at http://blog.benjamin-cabe.com.


More info on Eclipse IoT at 


http://iot.eclipse.org
name: Developing IoT solutions with Eclipse IoT open source services & frameworks

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
Agenda:

• RESTful web service on contrained low-power wireless devices using new IoT protocols like 6LoWPAN, RPL and COAP.

• Examples of how to use these technologies.

• How these technologies allow us to script the Internet of Things.

• Current research @ Vrije Universiteit Brussel.

• Networking @ the foyer with drinks


In collaboration with VUB.

Detailed agenda follows.

Speakers:

Bart Lemmens has received his M.Sc. in Industrial Sciences with specialization electronics-ICT from the Erasmushogeschool Brussel, Belgium in 2008. He is currently pursuing his Ph.D. degree in Engineering Sciences at the Department of Electronics and Informatics from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel. His research interests include energy efficient and multi-channel Medium Access Control protocols for wireless sensor networks, multi-agent systems, and time synchronization in networks. He is currently employed as a researcher on the 6LowPan project where he is responsible for the implementation of web services for constrained environments (CoAP).

Kris Steenhaut obtained her master degree in electro-technical Engineering Sciences in 1984, her master degree in Computer Sciences in 1986 and the PhD in engineering sciences from Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB), Belgium in 1995. Within the IRIS research group of the Electronics and Informatics Department (ETRO) she coordinates the research on Wireless Sensor Networks and Future Internet Technology.

Examples of  projects are IDEA (Intelligent Distributed Environmental Assessment) and the ISEM project (Intelligent Sensorwebs for Environmental Monitoring) respectively supported by the Agency of Innovation by Science and Technology (IWT) and l'Institut d’Encouragement de la Recherche Scientifique et de l’Innovation de Bruxelles (Innoviris).  She cooperated or took a leading role in European ITEA consortia such as ESNA (European Sensor Network Architecture) (ITEA Gold medal award) and ISN (Interoperable Sensor Networks), focusing on deployment and ease of management.  She is also co-promotor of the SBO project Perpetual on machine learning for energy savings in smart systems and machines and in the EU CIP-ICT PSP project EDISON on intelligent sensor based lighting. Kris Steenhaut is an IEEE COMSOC member and author/co-author of more than 80 papers published in international journals or in proceedings of international peer reviewed conferences.
name: Web Services for Constrained Wireless Low-Power Devices

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
Agenda:


- openHAB by Thomas Eichstädt-Engelen
- Smartliving.io by Peter Leemans
- Networking & Drinks

-------------------------------

openHAB: open source automation software for your home by Thomas Eichstädt-Engelen


Abstract: 
----------

New IoT gadgets are hitting the market every single day so we can easily state that the Internet of Things has already revolutionised the Smart Home before it has even had any significant adoption. 


Unfortunately most of them only connect to their own proprietary backend, they usually do not interact with each other. But what if you need an action on one device to be triggered by a status change of an other device? Overarching automation logic is hardly possible in those setups - this is not really smart. 


The openHAB project seeks to overcome the challenges of interoperability and introduces a highly flexible architecture perfectly tailored to the needs of developers. This talk gives an overview of the things that are relevant in a Smart Home and shows how openHAB allows the creation of a personal Intranet of Things. Be prepared to see geeky hardware in the live demo of this session!"

Bio:
----

Thomas Eichstädt-Engelen, Principal Consultant at innoQ Deutschland, has a strong focus on developing individual custom software with Eclipse Technologies (Java, RCP, OSGi) primarily in the Smart Home sector. He is Co-Project-Lead of the Eclipse Smarthome and the openHAB project where he is committer since 2010.


SmartLiving.io: Build your own Personal Internet of Things by Peter Leemans

Abstract:
----------

SmartLiving.io is a first project build on the Open IoT AllThingsTalk Platform which connect things you own, make or buy, with one app to rule them.


The Internet of Things will impact our lives dramatically, as well in our professional as in our private lives. With SmartLiving we want to give consumers the possibility to create their own Internet of Things which transcends existing home automation systems.

Traditional home automation systems are known to be closed, expensive, require to ‘rewire’ your home and are already ‘outdated’ the moment you install them.

SmartLiving is based on a SCALABLE and OPEN platform allow you to connect the devices you already own, such as you SmartPhone, devices you make yourself as a hobby and smart devices you already can buy, with the online services you love.

The project targets as well the makers and developers as the early majority communities and tries to bring them together. Where makers can contribute in creating solutions which are required by the crowd, developers contribute and benefit from delivering the killer apps which users are waiting for.  Our goal is to create an ecosystem around the personal Internet of Things.

SmartLiving’s mantra? Connect devices you own, make or buy, to the web services you love, with one app to rule them all.

Bio:
-----

Peter Leemans, has more than 20 years of experience in the ICT sector. First in industrial automation and the last 10 years in the Cloud Computing business as founder and manager of Thinfactory, a Belgium Cloud Service Provider ‘avant la lettre’.

The passion of automation and cloud computing converge today in a new exciting project.

AllThingsTalk is a Belgium based Internet of Things Startup with European ambitions delivering a scalable and open IoT platform built on industry standards.


Sponsored by:

Strata Conference Barcelona
Discount code (20%) = UGIOTBE20

Catering & location provided by:
name: Smart Home Automation

group.name: IoTBE - the Belgian Internet of Things community

description:
In collaboration with the Brussels Data Science Meetup!

Agenda

• 19:00 – How smart does the Internet of Things needs to be? by Frederik Santens 


• 19:30 – Semantic Annotation and Reasoning for Sensor Data by Erik Mannens, Prof. PhD. MEng. MSc.- Prof. on Big Data Semantics @ iMinds-MMLab

• 20:15 – Presenation – Prof. Ann Nowé, head of the VUB ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE LAB.

• 21:00 – Round Tabel Q&A & Wrap up Philippe Van Impe

• 21:30 – Networking in KultuurKaffee 

Abstract

The Internet of Things (IOT) will soon produce a massive volume and variety of data at unprecedented velocity. If "Big Data" is the product of the IOT, "Data Science" is it's soul. 

Let's define our terms:

• Internet of Things (IOT): equipping all physical and organic things in the world with identifying intelligent devices allowing the near real-time collecting and sharing of data between machines and humans. The IOT era has already begun, albeit in it's first primitive stage.

• Data Science: the analysis of data creation. May involve machine learning, algorithm design, computer science, modeling, statistics, analytics, math, artificial intelligence and business strategy.

• Big Data: the collection, storage, analysis and distribution/access of large data sets. Usually includes data sets with sizes beyond the ability of standard software tools to capture, curate, manage, and process the data within a tolerable elapsed time.

• We are in the pre-industrial age of data technology and science used to process and understand data. Yet the early evidence provides hope that we can manage and extract knowledge and wisdom from this data to improve life, business and public services at many levels.
name: Data Science and the Internet of Things
